definitions.text: the beginning of anything
examples: it was off to a good start

definitions.text: the time at which something is supposed to begin
examples: they got an early start
she knew from the get-go that he was the man for her

definitions.text: a turn to be a starter (in a game at the beginning)
examples: he got his start because one of the regular pitchers was in the hospital
his starting meant that the coach thought he was one of their best linemen

definitions.text: a sudden involuntary movement
examples: he awoke with a start

definitions.text: the act of starting something
examples: he was responsible for the beginning of negotiations

definitions.text: a line indicating the location of the start of a race or a game
a signal to begin (as in a race)
examples: the starting signal was a green light
the runners awaited the start

definitions.text: the advantage gained by beginning early (as in a race)
examples: with an hour's start he will be hard to catch

definitions.text: take the first step or steps in carrying out an action
examples: We began working at dawn
Who will start?
Get working as soon as the sun rises!
The first tourists began to arrive in Cambodia
He began early in the day
Let's get down to work now

definitions.text: set in motion, cause to start
examples: The U.S. started a war in the Middle East
The Iraqis began hostilities
begin a new chapter in your life

definitions.text: leave
examples: The family took off for Florida

definitions.text: have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense
examples: The DMZ begins right over the hill
The second movement begins after the Allegro
Prices for these homes start at $250,000

definitions.text: bring into being
examples: He initiated a new program
Start a foundation

definitions.text: get off the ground
examples: Who started this company?
We embarked on an exciting enterprise
I start my day with a good breakfast
We began the new semester
The afternoon session begins at 4 PM
The blood shed started when the partisans launched a surprise attack

definitions.text: move or jump suddenly, as if in surprise or alarm
examples: She startled when I walked into the room

definitions.text: get going or set in motion
examples: We simply could not start the engine
start up the computer

definitions.text: begin or set in motion
examples: I start at eight in the morning
Ready, set, go!

definitions.text: begin work or acting in a certain capacity, office or job
examples: Take up a position
start a new job

definitions.text: play in the starting lineup
have a beginning characterized in some specified way
examples: The novel begins with a murder
My property begins with the three maple trees
Her day begins with a workout
The semester begins with a convocation ceremony

definitions.text: begin an event that is implied and limited by the nature or inherent function of the direct object
examples: begin a cigar
She started the soup while it was still hot
We started physics in 10th grade

definitions.text: bulge outward
examples: His eyes popped
